data.name: Real world case 1 - Sort but move element to the end
data.description:
You will be supplied with a jumbled array of strings and a string that matches a string within the array.

Your task is to sort the list alphabetically, but the supplied string should appear at the end of the list.

Example

array_to_be_sorted = ['Bonobo', 'Zebra', 'Lynx', 'Ferret', 'Antelope']
string_to_be_at_bottom = 'Lynx'

The result should look like:

['Antelope', 'Bonobo', 'Ferret', 'Zebra', 'Lynx']

All arrays contain unique strings
All strings are valid

Enjoy!



Real world application

This came from a drop down selection box where the client required the list to be sorted alphabetically, but with the wild card category 'Other' appearing at the bottom of the list.
